p: Many previous studies were conducted to discover and predict the spatial and temporal patterns of dengue by using mapping techniques [ 5– 8], dynamical models [ 9, 10] or statistical methods [ 6, 7, 11, 12]. The recent dengue outbreak in China also drew similar analysis, such as inferring the spatiotemporal patterns of dengue transmission [ 6, 7, 9– 11], and identifying the determinants of spatial variations in the dengue epidemic [ 6, 11, 12]. However, existing studies usually focused on one or several cities, and the spatiotemporal heterogeneity of the transmission patterns remains little understood at a finer scale of Guangdong.
